label: ABC2_tP16_92_a_a_b-001
title: $\gamma$-LiAlO$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
LiAlO$_{2}$ exists in many different forms.  We describe them using the notation of (Liu, 2018): \begin{itemize} \item $\alpha$, synthesized from Al$_{2}$O$_{3}$ and Li$_{2}$CO$_{3}$ at 600$^{\circ}$C (Marezio, 1966) forms in the \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_hR4_166_a_b_c-001}{Caswellsilverite $F5_{1}$ structure, space group $R\overline{3}m$ \#166}. \item $\beta$ is the low temperature structure (Thery, 1961) forming in the \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_oP16_33_a_a_2a-003}{LiGaO$_{2}$ structure, space group $Pna2_{1}$ \#33}. \item $\beta'$ is a high-pressure monoclinic phase formed at 1.8 GPa   and 370$^{\circ}$C, but there is not enough information provided to determine either the space group or occupied Wyckoff positions (Chang, 1968). \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_tP16_92_a_a_b-001}{$\gamma$} (this structure) is the standard phase under ambient conditions.  It is tetragonal (Marezio, 1965), space group $P4_{1}2_{1}2$ \#92. \item $\delta$ is formed at high pressures (9 GPa) under shock compression and takes the \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_tI16_141_a_b_e-003}{$\gamma$-LiFeO$_{2}$} structure. \item $\epsilon$, formed from Al$_{2}$O$_{3}$ and LiH at 500$^{\circ}$C,  (Debray, 1960) is a cubic phase (space group $I4_{1}32$ \#214) with 48 formula units in a cube 12.65{\AA} on a side, but the atomic positions were not determined. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_mC24_12_ah_cg_ij-001}{$\zeta$} is a predicted high-pressure monoclinic structure (Liu, 2018), (space group $C2/m$ \#12).  It is apparently not related to the $\beta'$ phase. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The $\alpha$, $\beta'$ and $\delta$ phases are metastable under ambient conditions, but transform to $\gamma$-LiAlO$_{2}$ upon heating. (Liu, 2008)
